brand_info.name: adidas
brand_info.positioning: A global sports brand creating performance products for athletes and sport-inspired products for sport culture, guided by a purpose-led and sustainability-oriented approach.
brand_info.vision: Through sport, we have the power to change lives.
brand_info.mission: To be the best sports brand in the world.
brand_info.origin_story: Registered on August 18, 1949 by Adolf "Adi" Dassler in Herzogenaurach, Germany as the 'Adolf Dassler adidas Sportschuhfabrik', introducing the now-iconic 3-Stripes.

brand_values.brand_promise: Enable people to harness the power of sport through innovative, credible products and experiences that connect performance with culture.
differentiators: Blend of performance innovation and sport culture influence
Purpose-led initiatives focused on people and planet
non_negotiables: Clear brand codes (3-Stripes, Trefoil where relevant)

psychographics.lifestyle: Sport-active individuals and sport-culture participants spanning training, team sports, running, and everyday streetwear
psychographics.behavior: Engages with sport as performance and identity; follows athletes, teams, creators, and drops; expects functional credibility and cultural relevance

tone_dos: Center sport as an enabler of change
tone_donts: Overly sentimental storytelling without sport connection

logo.primary_logo: 3-Bar Performance logo for sport performance; Trefoil logo for Originals heritage
logo.usage_rules: High-contrast placements with clear space; avoid distortions; do not place where readability is compromised
logo.lockup_behavior: Consistent sizing and alignment; often corner placement or anchored to grid margins
logo.safe_area: Minimum padding equals the height of one logo element (bar or Trefoil leaf height), maintaining clear space on all sides

color_system.color_usage_rules: High-contrast foundations with sport-specific accent colors introduced per category or campaign; prioritize clarity and readability over decorative palettes

typography.primary_font: adidas proprietary sans-serif system (brand type family used across adidas communications)
typography.secondary_font: Neutral sans-serif for UI and long-form readability

layout_principles.grid_system: Modular grid with strong edge alignment and clear hierarchy
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Functional, allowing breathing room for logo and product read
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-led with concise copy overlays or adjacent blocks
layout_principles.cta_placement: Lower third or aligned to grid edges; digital CTAs often below primary visual
layout_principles.alignment: Clean left or center alignment; consistent baseline and margin logic

preferred_photographers: Not fixed; varies by campaign and category
style.camera_feel: In-the-moment energy with performance credibility and cultural edge
style.pose_guidelines: Movement-first posing; natural athletic tension; training and game-real gestures; confident stance in lifestyle scenes
style.casting_attitude: Athletes and creators portrayed as capable, self-driven, and community-connected

technical.lighting: Natural light or dramatic directional light; studio used for product clarity and hero moments
technical.grain: Clean digital with occasional filmic texture for heritage or culture narratives
technical.depth_of_field: Variable; shallow for portraits and product focus, deeper for action context
technical.color_grading: Neutral foundation with category-driven accents; skin tones preserved; blacks stay rich

model_casting.diversity: Broad and explicit inclusion across gender expression, body types, and backgrounds
model_casting.attitude: Determined, resilient, and creative; approachable confidence

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Product is readable and functional; in action it remains connected to the athlete story, in lifestyle it remains a clear brand signifier
product_presentation.styling_approach: Sport-functional fit for performance; clean street styling for Originals; avoid clutter that hides key product cues
avoid: Over-stylized fashion that breaks sport credibility

motion_rules.pacing: Fast cuts for action; rhythmic pacing for creator narratives; occasional slow-motion emphasis on movement mechanics
motion_rules.transitions: Hard cuts, kinetic match cuts, and graphic wipes aligned to beat; minimal ornamental transitions

visual_dos: Balance sport function and culture cues
visual_donts: Overly staged action that feels fake
Busy overlays that reduce product readability
copy_dos: Connect sport to self-expression and community

can_evolve: Casting mix by culture and region

retail.soundscape: Up-tempo contemporary playlists aligned to sport categories and local culture

digital.tone_adjustment: More direct and product-functional in e-commerce; more cultural and creator-led on social

platform_behavior.Instagram: Athlete and creator-led reels, short motivational copy, product tags
platform_behavior.Website: Category landing pages with strong visuals, clear benefit copy, and product storytelling modules
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Drop highlights, campaign chapters, and concise purpose notes

print.paper: Coated or semi-matte stock depending on category; high-contrast reproduction
print.cover_rules: Bold hero imagery with clear logo placement and minimal supporting text

logo_misuse_examples: Trefoil used for performance-only categories where Performance logo is standard
